subject: Climate & Environment
title: California's Fire Crisis
description: A short lesson to help you apply California's Fire Crisis.

hook.text: California's fire season used to last four months. Now it's nearly year-round.

buildup.text: Decades of fire suppression left forests overgrown. Dead wood accumulated as fuel.

discovery.text: Drought, heat waves, and Santa Ana winds create explosive conditions every autumn.

twist.text: The Camp Fire in 2018 destroyed the town of Paradise in hours, killing 85 people.

climax.text: Insurance companies are leaving California. Millions of homes are becoming uninsurable.

punchline.text: The state that symbolizes the future is already living the climate crisis.

quiz.question: Why did decades of fire suppression make California's fires worse?
options: Dead wood accumulated as fuel in overgrown forests
